summary_reasoning: This report demonstrates solid analytical depth with multiple company-specific syntheses that go beyond generic industry commentary. The analyst provides several original insights including the specific quantification of S&P's pricing power (3%-4% annual increases with detailed basis point progressions), the strategic rationale for the mobility spinoff with quantified impact (11% revenue, 9% operating profits), and a nuanced analysis linking tariff uncertainty to lowered guidance across specific segments. The valuation includes novel drivers like the IHS Markit integration effects and margin expansion trajectory to 52% by 2029. While some content covers standard moat analysis, the report synthesizes multiple data points into actionable, decision-relevant conclusions with specific catalysts and timelines.

insights_classified.text: S&P raised its January 2025 list price by about 2.5% year over year on corporate bond ratings to 8.10 basis points
The mobility division spinoff makes sense as it represents about 11% of revenue and 9% of adjusted operating profits but had limited relevance to other segments
Amid tariff-induced market uncertainty, S&P lowered its 2025 revenue outlook by 1% at the midpoint
We expect about 52% adjusted operating margins in 2029, which compares with 49% in 2024
S&P Global has an array of high-margin, moaty businesses
